item.title: Theory, innovations and applications of stimulated Raman scattering microscopy
item.author: Wei MinJi-Xin ChengYasuyuki Ozeki
item.content:encoded:
This Review provides an overview of the theoretical foundations, recent advances and promising applications of Raman scattering microscopy.

Wei MinJi-Xin ChengYasuyuki Ozeki

Nature Photonics

item.title: van der Waals materials for waveguide QED
item.author: Alexander Poddubny
item.content:encoded:
Guiding light is an essential task in optics, from optical fibres to compact nanoscale systems. Here, a few-atoms-thin MoTe2 layer embedded into a planar waveguide emits photons into waveguide modes that propagate coherently, paving the way for waveguide quantum electrodynamics with van der Waals materials.

Alexander Poddubny

Nature Photonics

item.title: Physicists disagree wildly on what quantum mechanics says about reality, Nature survey shows
item.author: Elizabeth Gibney
item.content:encoded:
First major attempt to chart researchers’ views finds interpretations in conflict.

Elizabeth Gibney

Nature

item.title: Physicists should revel in the diversity of ways to understand quantum mechanics
item.author: N/A
item.content:encoded:
Nature survey shows that disagreement about the meaning of quantum physics remains strong, even 100 years in. And that’s OK.

Nature

item.title: Synthesis of bulk hexagonal diamond
item.author: Liuxiang YangKah Chun LauHo-kwang Mao
item.content:encoded:
The synthesis, recovery and detailed characterization of bulk hexagonal diamond under high pressure and temperature conditions using precursor graphite carbon is described, demonstrating the first successful synthesis in the 100 µm to millimetre size range.

Liuxiang YangKah Chun LauHo-kwang Mao

Nature

item.title: Predicting topological entanglement entropy in a Rydberg analogue simulator
item.author: Linda MauronZakari DenisGiuseppe Carleo
item.content:encoded:
A numerical approach capable of simulating large-scale Rydberg atom quantum systems suggests that protocols for preparing topological states can produce experimental signatures of these states without reaching a topological phase.

Linda MauronZakari DenisGiuseppe Carleo

Nature Physics

item.title: Coherent spectroscopy with a single antiproton spin
item.author: B. M. LataczS. R. ErleweinS. Ulmer
item.content:encoded:
Coherent quantum transition spectroscopy of the spin of a single antiproton is reported, demonstrating Rabi oscillations of the spin and enabling improved measurement of matter/antimatter symmetry using proton and antiproton magnetic moments.

B. M. LataczS. R. ErleweinS. Ulmer

Nature

Daniel JafferisAlexander ZlokapaMaria Spiropulu

item.title: The breakthrough proof bringing mathematics closer to a grand unified theory
item.author: Ananyo Bhattacharya
item.content:encoded:
The Langlands programme has inspired and befuddled mathematicians for more than 50 years. A major advance has now opened up new worlds for them to explore.

Ananyo Bhattacharya

Nature

item.title: Entanglement accelerates quantum simulation
item.author: Qi ZhaoYou ZhouAndrew M. Childs
item.content:encoded:
Large quantum systems with high entanglement are difficult to simulate with classical methods, but now it is shown that entanglement may be beneficial for quantum simulations.

Qi ZhaoYou ZhouAndrew M. Childs

Nature Physics

item.author: Pedro Sales RodriguezJohn M. RobinsonSergio H. Cantú

item.author: Lishu Wu
item.content:encoded:
Lishu Wu

item.title: Measurement of phonon angular momentum
item.author: H. ZhangN. PeshcherenkoH. Miao
item.content:encoded:
Theory predicts that phonons—quanta of lattice vibrations—can carry finite angular momentum and thus influence physical properties of materials. Now phonons with angular momentum have been seen in tellurium with a chiral crystal structure.

H. ZhangN. PeshcherenkoH. Miao

Nature Physics

item.title: Topological excitonic insulator with tunable momentum order
item.author: Md Shafayat HossainZi-Jia ChengM. Zahid Hasan
item.content:encoded:
Experimental systems in which non-trivial topology is driven by spontaneous symmetry breaking are rare. Now, topological gaps resulting from two excitonic condensates have been demonstrated in a three-dimensional material.

Md Shafayat HossainZi-Jia ChengM. Zahid Hasan

Nature Physics

item.title: Ytterbium dopants for quantum simulation
item.author: Diana Serrano
item.content:encoded:
Understanding and controlling many-body interactions is essential for advancing quantum science. A crystal containing millions of strongly interacting ytterbium ion dopants has now been used to simulate complex quantum many-body phenomena.

Diana Serrano

Nature Physics

item.title: Single nuclear spin detection and control in a van der Waals material
item.author: Xingyu GaoSumukh VaidyaTongcang Li
item.content:encoded:
The detection and coherent control of single 13C nuclear spins in hexagonal boron nitride at room temperature enables the use of van der Waals materials in upcoming quantum technologies.

Xingyu GaoSumukh VaidyaTongcang Li

Nature

item.title: Integrated cryogenic chip controls spin qubits
item.author: N/A
item.content:encoded:
Building a quantum computer out of silicon allows the computer’s qubits to be integrated seamlessly with their control electronics, but the control circuits can degrade qubit performance. A cryogenic control chip counters this risk and holds promise for scaling up the number of qubits.

Nature

item.title: Quantum thermalization and Floquet engineering in a spin ensemble with a clock transition
item.author: Mi LeiRikuto FukumoriAndrei Faraon
item.content:encoded:
Using Floquet engineering, an ensemble of ytterbium-171 ions in an yttrium orthovanadate host crystal provides a platform for studying the dynamics of different quantum many-body models, including the realization of a time-crystalline phase.

Mi LeiRikuto FukumoriAndrei Faraon

Nature Physics

item.title: Nanophotonic quantum skyrmions enabled by semiconductor cavity quantum electrodynamics
item.author: Jiantao MaJiawei YangJin Liu
item.content:encoded:
Quantum optical skyrmions are promising for quantum photonic applications but have not been experimentally realized. Now nanophotonic quantum skyrmions are generated using a semiconductor quantum dot–Gaussian microcavity quantum electrodynamics system.

Jiantao MaJiawei YangJin Liu

Nature Physics

item.title: Quantum correlations of spontaneous two-photon emission from a quantum dot
item.author: Shunfa LiuYangpeng WangJin Liu
item.content:encoded:
Quantum correlations of spontaneous two-photon emission emitted from a bright quantum dot device are revealed, facilitating the creation of entangled photons with near-unity fidelity.

Shunfa LiuYangpeng WangJin Liu

Nature

item.title: How short peptides disassemble tau fibrils in Alzheimer’s disease
item.author: Ke HouPeng GeDavid S. Eisenberg
item.content:encoded:
Cryo-electron and atomic force microscopy shed light on how fibrils of the protein tau, which accumulate in the brain of people with Alzheimer’s disease, can be disassembled by short peptides, providing a possible route towards developing treatments.

Ke HouPeng GeDavid S. Eisenberg

Nature

item.title: Moiré materials based on M-point twisting
item.author: Dumitru CălugăruYi JiangB. Andrei Bernevig
item.content:encoded:
A new class of moiré materials based on monolayers with triangular lattices and low-energy states at the M points of the Brillouin zone is introduced, demonstrating emergent momentum-space non-symmorphic symmetries, a kagome plane-wave lattice structure, and potential quasi-one-dimensionality.

Dumitru CălugăruYi JiangB. Andrei Bernevig

Nature

item.title: Tunable nanophotonic devices and cavities based on a two-dimensional magnet
item.author: Ahmet Kemal DemirLuca NessiRiccardo Comin
item.content:encoded:
CrSBr, a van der Waals antiferromagnetic semiconductor, is used to fabricate photonic crystal slabs, featuring exceptional in situ control over optical behaviour and thus enabling precise manipulation of photonic modes at near-visible and infrared wavelengths.

Ahmet Kemal DemirLuca NessiRiccardo Comin

Nature Photonics

item.title: ‘Tour de force’ experiment probes quantum tunnelling in action
item.author: Elizabeth Gibney
item.content:encoded:
Probing photons inside a barrier also challenges a long-standing interpretation of quantum physics.

Elizabeth Gibney

Nature

item.title: High-harmonic generation meets quantum optics
item.author: Marcelo Ciappina
item.content:encoded:
Quantum light is shown to perturb strong-field interactions in solids, revealing photon bunching in high-harmonic sidebands. The generation of attosecond non-classical states opens up quantum-enhanced photonics in novel temporal and spectral domains.

Marcelo Ciappina

Nature Photonics

item.title: On-chip programmable nonlinearity
item.author: Fei Xia
item.content:encoded:
Programmable nonlinearities — including control over the response order up to high orders — can now be realized on-chip at ultralow power via field programmability. This advance paves the way for more scalable and energy-efficient photonic computing in applications such as machine learning, optical signal processing and communications, analogue computing and quantum photonics.

Fei Xia

Nature Photonics

item.title: Hybrid quantum network for sensing in the acoustic frequency range
item.author: Valeriy NovikovJun JiaEugene Simon Polzik
item.content:encoded:
A hybrid quantum network combining entangled light with an atomic spin ensemble engineered to act as a negative-mass oscillator enables frequency-dependent quantum noise reduction for measurements in the acoustic noise frequency range relevant for gravitational-wave detection.

Valeriy NovikovJun JiaEugene Simon Polzik

Nature

item.title: Resolving the phase of Fano resonance wave packets with photoelectron frequency-resolved optical gating
item.author: Pengju ZhangHao LiangHans Jakob Wörner
item.content:encoded:
The researchers demonstrate direct measurement and complete characterization of structured electronic wave packets created within a prototypical Fano resonance. The method may be broadly applicable to the study of ultrafast processes, especially electronic ones, in complex systems, as well as coherent control of such systems on their fundamental timescales.

Pengju ZhangHao LiangHans Jakob Wörner

Nature Photonics

item.title: Atoms revolt against tweezer-imposed order
item.author: A. VukicsP. Domokos
item.content:encoded:
The combination of optical tweezer arrays with high-finesse cavities opens the door to the study of mesoscopic finite-size effects in the critical dynamics and optomechanical response of atomic ensembles.

A. VukicsP. Domokos

Nature Physics

item.title: Broadband transient full-Stokes luminescence spectroscopy
item.author: Antti-Pekka M. ReponenMarcel MattesSascha Feldmann
item.content:encoded:
A high-sensitivity, broadband, transient, full-Stokes spectroscopy setup is demonstrated, which can detect quickly varying small signals from chiral emitters.

Antti-Pekka M. ReponenMarcel MattesSascha Feldmann

Nature

item.title: Droplets of three electrons behave like a liquid
item.author: Masaya Kataoka
item.content:encoded:
Experiments in which systems of interacting electrons are split apart reveal the signatures of a liquid-like state — even for as few as three electrons.

Masaya Kataoka

Nature

item.title: Coherent bunching of anyons and dissociation in an interference experiment
item.author: Bikash GhoshMaria LabendikDavid F. Mross
item.content:encoded:
The coherent bunching of anyons and their dissociation was observed in an interference experiment.

Bikash GhoshMaria LabendikDavid F. Mross

Nature

item.title: Here’s why China’s science and innovation model is thriving
item.author: Jacob Dreyer
item.content:encoded:
A combination of government planning, academic ambition and bold entrepreneurship are hallmarks of the country’s success.

Jacob Dreyer

Nature

item.title: Soft magnetic hysteresis in a dysprosium amide–alkene complex up to 100 kelvin
item.author: Jack Emerson-KingGemma K. GransburyDavid P. Mills
item.content:encoded:
A dysprosium amide–alkene complex shows soft magnetic hysteresis loops up to 100 kelvin, arising from the high charge density of the amide ligands and the structural role of the pendant alkene.

Jack Emerson-KingGemma K. GransburyDavid P. Mills

Nature

item.title: Spin-qubit control with a milli-kelvin CMOS chip
item.author: Samuel K. BarteeWill GilbertDavid J. Reilly
item.content:encoded:
CMOS-based circuits can be integrated with silicon-based spin qubits and can be controlled at milli-kelvin temperatures, which can potentially help scale up these systems.

Samuel K. BarteeWill GilbertDavid J. Reilly

Nature

item.title: Quantum neural networks can be normal
item.author: Jayne Thompson
item.content:encoded:
As many classical neural networks get larger, they can be described as Gaussian processes, the generalization of the normal distribution to infinite dimensions. A similar connection has now been proven for quantum neural networks.

Jayne Thompson

Nature Physics

item.title: Ångström-tunable polarization-resolved solid-state photon sources
item.author: Yinhui KanPaul C. V. ThraneSergey I. Bozhevolnyi
item.content:encoded:
A platform based on quantum-emitter-embedded metasurfaces with a microcavity that can be tuned by a micro-electromechanical system is demonstrated, enabling dynamic photon emission with narrow bandwidth, ångström-level wavelength tunability and polarization switching.

Yinhui KanPaul C. V. ThraneSergey I. Bozhevolnyi

Nature Photonics

item.title: Neutron scattering and thermodynamic evidence for emergent photons and fractionalization in a pyrochlore spin ice
item.author: Bin GaoFélix DesrochersPengcheng Dai
item.content:encoded:
Quantum spin-ice phases are predicted to have emergent gauge fields and fractionalization. Neutron scattering and thermodynamic measurements of the quantum spin-ice candidate Ce2Zr2O7 show features consistent with these predictions.

Bin GaoFélix DesrochersPengcheng Dai

Nature Physics

item.title: Emergent exchange-driven giant magnetoelastic coupling in a correlated itinerant ferromagnet
item.author: Carolina A. MarquesLuke C. RhodesPeter Wahl
item.content:encoded:
Magnetostructural changes are usually small and driven by spin–orbit coupling. Now, electron–lattice coupling enhanced by exchange interactions is shown to produce giant magnetostriction in a correlated ferromagnet.

Carolina A. MarquesLuke C. RhodesPeter Wahl

Nature Physics

item.title: Experimental demonstration of breakeven for a compact fermionic encoding
item.author: Ramil NigmatullinKévin HémeryHenrik Dreyer
item.content:encoded:
Digital quantum simulations of fermionic models have so far been based on the Jordan–Wigner encoding, which is computationally expensive. An alternative and more efficient encoding scheme is now demonstrated in a trapped-ion quantum computer.

Ramil NigmatullinKévin HémeryHenrik Dreyer

Nature Physics

item.title: Happy birthday quantum mechanics! I got a ticket to the ultimate physics party
item.author: Elizabeth Gibney
item.content:encoded:
Nature reporter joins hundreds of physicists on a remote island to celebrate Heisenberg’s enlightening trip there 100 years ago.

Elizabeth Gibney

Nature

item.title: Science diplomacy is in trouble
item.author: V. M. CastañoG. Violini
item.content:encoded:
Geopolitical tensions pose a threat to international collaborations and the democratization of science.

V. M. CastañoG. Violini

Nature Physics

item.title: Cheat-proof random numbers generated from quantum entanglement
item.author: Peter Brown
item.content:encoded:
A quantum random-number generator has been developed that uses classical cryptography to certify that its output was produced by a quantum process.

Peter Brown

Nature

item.title: A neutral-atom Hubbard quantum simulator in the cryogenic regime
item.author: Muqing XuLev Haldar KendrickMarkus Greiner
item.content:encoded:
A several-fold reduction in temperature is accomplished using a neutral-atom Hubbard quantum simulator by transforming a low-entropy product state into strongly correlated states of interest via dynamic control of the model parameters.

Muqing XuLev Haldar KendrickMarkus Greiner

Nature

item.title: Traceable random numbers from a non-local quantum advantage
item.author: Gautam A. KavuriJasper PalfreeLynden K. Shalm
item.content:encoded:
A study demonstrates a public generator of random numbers based on device-independent techniques, with the randomness being fully auditable and traceable.

Gautam A. KavuriJasper PalfreeLynden K. Shalm

Nature

item.title: Ultrasensitive single-ion electrometry in a magnetic field gradient
item.author: F. BonusC. KnappW. K. Hensinger
item.content:encoded:
Trapped ions are promising for electrometry but limited by their weak intrinsic spin coupling to electric fields. Now it is shown that using a magnetic field gradient enhances sensitivity and enables precise measurements across subhertz to kilohertz frequencies.

F. BonusC. KnappW. K. Hensinger

Nature Physics

item.title: Quantum physicists unveil most ‘trustworthy’ random-number generator yet
item.author: Davide Castelvecchi
item.content:encoded:
Upgraded system produces strings of random bits in a process that is fully traceable.

Davide Castelvecchi

Nature

item.title: Extreme-ultraviolet spatiotemporal vortices via high harmonic generation
item.author: Rodrigo Martín-HernándezGuan GuiCarlos Hernández-García
item.content:encoded:
The generation of spatiotemporal optical vortices in the extreme-ultraviolet regime is demonstrated via high harmonic generation. Topologically coupled at the nanometre and attosecond domains, these light beams are attractive for exploring electronic dynamics in magnetic materials, chiral media and nanostructures.

Rodrigo Martín-HernándezGuan GuiCarlos Hernández-García

Nature Photonics

item.title: Peter Lax obituary: mathematician who pioneered computer-based solutions to real-world problems
item.author: Jeremy Berg
item.content:encoded:
The Abel prizewinner’s pragmatic approach to solving differential equations was influential across fields ranging from weather forecasting to starting nuclear chain reactions.

Jeremy Berg

Nature

item.title: Do our observations make reality happen?
item.author: Alyssa Ney
item.content:encoded:
Finally answering the most-vexed question in quantum theory might mean redefining what is real.

Alyssa Ney

Nature
